meta.hint: The subject and the verb in a sentence must agree. The subject pronouns she, he and it name only one person or thing, so they are singular.  When a subject is singular, use a singular verb. Singular verbs end in -s or -es. Example - He watches the neighbour's baby.                  It needs a new lock. The subject pronouns we and they name more than one person or thing, so they are plural.  The pronoun you can also be plural. When a subject is plural, use a plural verb. Plural  verbs usually do not end in -s or -es. Example - We walk home.                  They finish early. The singular subject pronouns I and you do not follow these rules. They name only one person or thing, but they should be used with plural verbs. Example - You sing better than I do!                  I close the windows at night.
meta.question: Select the best verb to complete the sentence.
